job.title: Software Engineer
job.industry: Government Administration,Information Services,Information Technology and Services
job.description: We are looking to recruit a Software Engineer The RoleTo review, analyze, and modify programming systems including encoding, testing, debugging, and installing application systems to support the needs of the Department.The Ideal CandidateWill consult with users to identify current operating procedures and to clarify program objectives.Must be familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures, have extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.Will be required to perform tasks which include:Assisting with issues and remaining development related to the WebSphere Liberty 9 / Power BI ReleaseAssisting with Redesign the Provider Liability Account (PLA) interface and redesign the recovery of the Personal Support Worker (PSW) PLA.Supporting the enhancement of the Provider page, PSW page and Electronic Visit Verification (EVV) to help track required training for PSWsFacilitating the creation of capability for CMEs to upload claims for Rationed Fee for Service (RFFS) billingFacilitating the transfer of the concepts and enhancements to existing team members to enable them to provide ongoing supportProviding consultation to senior leadership and helping with items in the Backlog to include Critical Priority Bugs and EnhancementsÂ Skill and Experience:Experience with eXPRS applicationExpert-level knowledge and experience with WebSphere Liberty 9 and Java 11Expert understanding of IBM DB2 UDB systems and conceptsProficient with Eclipse IDE Liberty 9 Plug In, Git source control conceptsExcellent communication skillsHighly skilled Java developerQualification: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or related field.6+years of equivalent experience in the field or a related area.
